poem:
**Puzzle**

In print's quiet black
numbers crave—
clues, interlocking,
forming smiles,
sharp pens scratch
boxes to fill,
across,
down,
seeking truth in lines,
circling around
to reveal
the small triumph
of right words
against the empty spaces
of morning.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Prize crossword No 29,416". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
